p: The phenol-sulfuric acid method uses sulfuric acid to hydrolyze polysaccharides into monosaccharides, followed by rapid dehydration to result in aldehyde derivatives that form orange-yellow compounds with phenol [ 26, 27]. The absorbance of these compounds was then measured at 490 nm at room temperature using a WFJ2100 UV-visible spectrophotometer, which was obtained from UNICO (Shanghai, China).
